author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of youth in the age group of 18-30 years participated in the mini-marathon held in the city recently to create awareness among the public on the importance of exercising their franchise without fail in the Assembly elections.

V. Sampath, District Collector and District Election Officer, flagged off the mini-marathon from Mahatma Gandhi Stadium, in the presence of R. Sukumar, District Revenue Officer, K. R. Selvaraj, Corporation Commission, and K. Kavitha, Project Officer, District Rural Development Agency.

More than 500 youth, a majority of them college students, passed through Four Roads, New Bus Stand, Five Roads, Sarada College Road, Hasthampatti before returning to the stadium.
title: Mini marathon
